alert.note: Alert for Bear Lake and Bear River Valley; Wasatch Mountains I-80 North (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 19 at 3:44PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Weber...southeastern Cache...southwestern Rich and northeastern Morgan Counties through 415 PM MDT... At 343 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 20 miles southwest of Woodruff, or 22 miles northeast of Morgan, moving northwest at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Causey Reservoir. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. Get out of bodies of water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.

area.areaDesc: Bear Lake and Bear River Valley; Wasatch Mountains I-80 North
